newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat futures end firm after choppy session.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat futures end firm after choppy session.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat future ended slightly higher in choppy dealings on strength in the cash market, concerns over fall seeding delays and bullish estimates for USDA's quarterly stocks report, traders said.
"Cash basis is fired up because the farmer's hanging on to his wheat," a trader said.
Traders cited forecasts for extremely wet weather over the next four days in central and eastern Kansas and western Missouri, fueling fears of a delay in winter wheat plantings.
Additional support came from technical buying tied to signs that the market had reached a bottom for the near term.
KCBT wheat closed steady to two cents per bushel higher, with Dec up two cents at $4.39-1/4 a bushel.
KCBT estimated Wednesday's wheat futures volume at 21.185 million bushels, down from 34.310 million Tuesday.

Traders said Smoot Grain and LFG each sold 1.3 million Dec bushels. CIS sold 1.1 million Dec, while Chicago Corp bought 1.2 million Dec. FIMAT bought 1.5 million Dec and sold one million Dec, traders said.
